events.message: The insured has contacted the company to file a claim after a car collision that occurred yesterday afternoon causing significant damage.
The claim has been categorised as an auto accident case based on the description mentioning vehicle collision and damage.
A claims agent has been assigned to this case to assist the claimant with the process and guide them on next steps.
The insurance company has officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed its registration in the system.
The claimant has been asked to submit a police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a repair estimate from an authorized garage.
All requested documents including police report and photos were submitted by the claimant promptly for review and processing.
The insurer’s investigation unit has begun examining the submitted evidence and contacting third-party witnesses for verification.
Investigation has concluded with a confirmed liability on the other party involved in the vehicle accident, approved for settlement.
A settlement offer has been made to the claimant covering vehicle repairs and medical expenses related to the accident.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of the case and clarity of the settlement offer presented.
The claim has been formally approved by the insurer to proceed with payment based on investigation findings and claimant’s documentation.
The settlement payment was successfully issued to the claimant’s designated bank account covering all approved costs.
The insurance claim file has been closed after successful payment and final confirmation from both the claimant and insurer.
The claim documentation has been archived securely in the system for future reference and compliance purposes.
